explanation: The report is correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 forbids use of string.h functions in a way that can read past the bounds of the object pointed to. In the shown code there are two relevant uses of string.h operations that create that possibility: (a) the OS_CHECK_APINAME macro expands to OS_CHECK_STRING(timer_name,...). If OS_CHECK_STRING uses strlen (as Agent A hypothesizes) that strlen will scan until a NUL and therefore can read beyond the caller's buffer if the caller passed a non-NUL-terminated or shorter object. (b) OS_OBJECT_INIT uses strncpy(ref->namefield, nameval, sizeof(ref->namefield)-1). strncpy can also read up to the supplied length from nameval and thus will read beyond the source object if nameval is not NUL-terminated within that bound (or the caller provided a shorter object). Unless there is an external, enforced precondition that timer_name always points to a NUL-terminated object of sufficient size, these uses can result in out-of-bounds accesses and therefore violate Rule 21.17.
